title: Valid audio file upload via drag-and-drop
description: Verify that users can successfully upload an MP3 or WAV file under 25MB by dragging and dropping onto the FileUpload component, and see correct file metadata displayed.

steps.description: Navigate to homepage
Drag and drop a valid MP3 file less than 25MB onto the FileUpload component
Check that file metadata (name, size, duration) is displayed correctly
Verify no error message is shown and UI indicates successful upload

title: Valid audio file upload via browse dialog
description: Verify that users can select a valid MP3 or WAV file under 25MB using the browse dialog, and file metadata displays correctly.

steps.description: Navigate to homepage
Click browse button on FileUpload component and select a valid WAV file under 25MB
Check that file metadata (name, size, duration) is displayed correctly
Ensure no error messages appear and upload is accepted

title: Reject unsupported file type upload
description: Verify that uploading a file with an unsupported format (e.g., .txt, .pdf) triggers a clear error message and prevents upload.

steps.description: Attempt to upload a .txt file using drag-and-drop on FileUpload component
Verify display of clear error message about unsupported file type
Confirm file is not accepted or processed

title: Reject audio files exceeding 25MB
description: Verify uploading MP3 or WAV files larger than 25MB is blocked with an appropriate error message.

steps.description: Attempt to upload a valid MP3 file larger than 25MB via browse dialog
Confirm error message states file exceeds maximum size
Ensure file is not accepted for processing

title: Processing page shows accurate state transitions and progress
description: Verify the processing page correctly transitions through states: pending → processing → complete, with accurate progress bars and stem processing statuses.

steps.description: Upload valid audio file and start processing
Check processing page shows pending state initially
Verify progress bars update realistically with visual feedback during processing
Confirm each stem's status updates from pending to processing to complete
Ensure page redirects to results page on completion

title: Retry function works after processing failure
description: Verify that if the audio separation process fails, user can retry and processing restarts with all progress and states reset.

steps.description: Upload a valid audio file and simulate a processing failure (e.g., via mocked API response)
Check error message is displayed with retry option
Click retry button
Verify processing restarts from pending state with cleared progress bars

title: StemPlayer controls operate correctly for each stem
description: Verify play/pause, volume control, waveform seek, and download functionality on each StemPlayer component for vocals, drums, bass, and other stems.

steps.description: On results page, locate all 4 StemPlayer components
For each stem player, click play and confirm audio plays
Adjust volume slider and confirm volume changes accordingly
Click on different points on waveform visualizer and confirm seek position changes
Click download button on each stem and verify correct file is downloaded

title: WaveformVisualizer supports click-to-seek and shows playback progress
description: Verify that waveform visualization accurately reflects audio waveform, updates playback progress visually, and supports click-to-seek interaction.

steps.description: Start playback of a stem with WaveformVisualizer displayed
Confirm waveform visualization animates to show playback progress
Click on various points of waveform and verify player seeks to corresponding audio position

title: Results page UI displays four stems in grid with download all button
description: Verify that the results page layout presents all four stems in a grid with individual StemPlayer components and a functional 'Download All' button that downloads all stems sequentially.

steps.description: Complete processing workflow and arrive at results page
Confirm four stem players (vocals, drums, bass, other) are visible in grid layout
Locate and click the 'Download All' button
Verify that all four stems are downloaded sequentially without errors

title: Navigation header is fixed, responsive, with functional hamburger menu
description: Verify navigation header remains fixed on scroll, responds to different screen sizes properly, and mobile hamburger menu opens and closes navigation links.

steps.description: Load any main page (homepage, processing, results)
Scroll page and confirm header remains fixed at top
Verify header contents appear as per Brutalist branding
Resize browser to mobile viewport size
Click hamburger menu button
Confirm navigation menu expands and links are accessible
Click hamburger menu to close it
Confirm menu collapses properly

title: Homepage hero and feature sections render with smooth scroll navigation
description: Verify the homepage hero section uses large typography and Brutalist style, feature grid displays all key features, and navigation links smoothly scroll to page sections.

steps.description: Navigate to homepage
Confirm hero section shows massive typography and Brutalist styling
Verify feature showcase grid displays all major features
Click navigation links in header
Confirm page smoothly scrolls to correct section

title: API health check endpoint returns correct status
description: Verify the health check API returns JSON with API availability and backend readiness status, and appropriate HTTP status code.

steps.description: Send HTTP GET request to /api/health endpoint
Confirm response HTTP status is 200
Verify JSON response includes keys 'status' and 'backendReady'

title: File upload API validates file type and size correctly
description: Verify /api/upload rejects files of wrong type or size beyond 25MB with appropriate error responses and accepts valid files returning metadata.

steps.description: Send multipart/form-data POST with invalid file type to /api/upload
Confirm response status is 400 with relevant error message
Send POST with valid MP3 file > 25MB to /api/upload
Confirm response status is 400 for file size exceeded
Send POST with valid MP3 or WAV file < 25MB to /api/upload
Confirm response status is 200 and payload contains file metadata

title: Audio separation API streams progress JSON and cleans up temp files
description: Verify /api/separate correctly triggers Demucs Python process, streams incremental JSON progress updates, and removes temporary files on completion or failure.

steps.description: Send request to /api/separate with valid uploaded file reference
Confirm streaming of JSON progress updates occurs throughout processing
On normal completion verify final JSON message indicates success
Confirm temporary files are deleted after processing finishes

title: Critical user journey: happy path from upload to results
description: Verify full user journey from audio upload, processing start, progress observing, to results page with stems playback and download completes without error.

steps.description: Navigate to homepage and upload valid MP3 file under 25MB
Start processing and monitor processing page progress bars and statuses
Wait for redirect to results page
Verify four stem players are present with functional controls
Play each stem briefly
Download individual stems and verify files
Use 'Download All' button and confirm all stems download

title: Accessibility: keyboard navigation and screen reader support
description: Verify all interactive components (FileUpload, StemPlayers, navigation menu) are fully accessible via keyboard and screen reader compatible with appropriate ARIA labels and color contrast.

steps.description: Use tab/shift+tab to navigate all interactive elements on homepage and results page
Confirm focus outlines and correct tab order
Validate presence of ARIA roles and labels using accessibility tools
Ensure color contrast meets WCAG AA standards for all Brutalist colors

title: Bundle optimization lazy loads heavy components
description: Verify large components like StemPlayer, FileUpload, and WaveformVisualizer are dynamically imported and loaded only when needed, keeping initial bundle size below 1MB.

steps.description: Load homepage and measure initial bundle size
Confirm bundle size is below 1MB
Navigate to processing and results pages
Verify that heavy components are loaded dynamically (e.g., via network or dev tools)

title: Cross-browser compatibility on latest Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge
description: Verify key user workflows including file upload, processing, playback, and downloads function properly and UI renders correctly on latest stable versions of Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge browsers.

steps.description: Repeat main user journey (upload to results) on Chrome latest
Confirm functionality and UI correctness
Repeat tests on Firefox latest
Confirm no regressions or visual bugs
Repeat tests on Safari latest
Confirm full functionality and layout fidelity
Repeat tests on Edge latest
Verify no errors and UI consistency
